SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Provide More Reliable Keyboard Navigation for Guest Buyer Checkout

Deliver an uninterrupted checkout experience for a storefront guest buyer, regardless of whether they click the UI or use keyboard buttons to navigate the checkout flow. This release fixes an issue where pressing Enter (Windows) or Return (macOS) on the Process Payment button during checkout invalidated the cart and reset checkout.

Where: This change applies to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12) in Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.

Why: This issue caused the guest buyer to have to repeat all steps of the checkout flow again—a poor and time-consuming experience. Now, a guest user pressing Enter or Return on the Process Payment button successfully continues to the next step of checkout.

How: After you upgrade the managed package, the default Visualforce component for processing purchase order payments, ccPOPay.component, is updated with better handling for keyboard focus. If you haven't extended or overridden this component, your checkout experience is ready to go.

If you've extended or overridden ccPOPay.component, update your subscriber code to include a <form> element that contains both the Purchase Order field and the Process Payment button. Make sure that the form's ID is newWalletForm.

<form id="newWalletForm" action="" class="newPOForm" forceSSL="true">
DID THIS ARTICLE SOLVE YOUR ISSUE?
Let us know so we can improve!
Yes
No
title: Provide More Reliable Keyboard Navigation for Guest Buyer Checkout
